input.project_name: UPM-Replacement of 5no. failed IP CCTV cameras with Axis variants
input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):work in progress by Brando Dooley DDS

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value

scope_of_work.problem: Following the project to relocate the CCTV cabinet, during shut down of the system 5 CCTV cameras on Ph1 Roof failed to restart following commissioning of the CCTV system.
scope_of_work.scope:
Contractor to attend site to remove the 5 faulty cameras and install 5 new Axis P Series CCTV Cameras, configure the Milestone CCTV
Software for new cameras.
scope_of_work.justification: Outdoor CCTV cameras allow security to monitor the PH1 roof and external areas for any suspicious activity they also act as a deterrent. CCTV helps protect staff and property.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: 5 CCTV cameras remain off line with reduced coverage of Ph1 roof available through other CCTV cameras.

input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Neil Hauck (2):offer submitted by Neil Hauck

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem:
The latest NHB DRUPS oil samples have been returned with the following levels of fuel contamination:
Engine no.1 = 4.2%
Engine no.2 = 3.8%
Engine no.3 = 4.4%
Engine no.4 = 5.4%
scope_of_work.scope: To replace the engine oil and oil filters on all 4x DRUPS units at NHB and test via an on-load run on completion.
scope_of_work.justification: The OEM (Hitec) advises to replace the DRUPS engine oil and filters at 5% fuel contamination to protect the engine components from excessive wear or damage.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect:
Running the DRUPS above 5% oil/fuel contamination increases the risk of costly damage to the engine components and could increase the risk of fire within the engine compartments.

Due the current level of fuel contamination it is advised to resolve promptly eg: before the Christmas holidays when parts could have extended lead-times and personnel resource could be problematic.

input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Neil Hauck (2):rejected by Neil Hauck (3):offer submitted by Neil Hauck

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: CB/F32 (11kV vacuum circuit breaker) has developed a fault and will no longer operate as a functioning circuit breaker.
scope_of_work.scope:
1. CBRE to transfer critical load(s) to their alternate supplies.
2. CBRE to isolate RMU2 from the 11kV network.
3. 11kV Specialist to attend site and replace CB/F32.
4. 11kV Specialist to test CB/F32 on completion.
5. CBRE to re-instate RMU2 to the 11kV network.
6. CBRE to restore all critical load(s) to the previous supplies.

Works to be completed in normal working hours (Mon-Fri) between 08:00 and 16:00.
scope_of_work.justification:
CB/F32 supplies Transformer6 (supply to LV1 Building Services Switchboard).

While CB/F32 is unavailable, LV1 Building Services Switchboard is reduced to 1x supply (from Transformer12).

Replacement of CB/F32 will restore the 2nd supply to LV1 Switchboard and subsequently restore the site electrical distribution system to it's designed capability.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: LV1 Building Services Switchboard will remain at risk with only 1x supply available (from Transformer12).

input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):work in progress by Flo Hodkiewicz

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: IRS UPS Module 1 has a fault, when it has load transferred on it, it rejects and throws it back to the static bypass.
scope_of_work.scope: Specialist contractor Socomec, will attend site and with CBRE diagnose fault, repair fault, test all scenarios and then transfer load across from Static Bypass. Crest Chic will also be in attendance for the install of a temporary Load bank  so we can increase load  on the IRS generators due to low RAW load, whilst the repair works is being undertaken.
scope_of_work.justification: Currently we are sat with one UPS Module on the IRS system and we are sat at N. The works require to be carried out to put us back upto N+1 and help with the resilience of the IRS equipment.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Currently we are sat with one UPS Module on the IRS system and we are sat at N. The works require to be carried out to put us back upto N+1 and help with the resilience of the IRS equipment.
